page.title: 02Tourism in Reculver,
page.content: Reculver is a quiet peaceful place surrounded by caravan parks and farmland.The sea is unfortunately polluted but you can risk going swimming in it.The beach is very muddy when the tide is out but there are some patches of sand suitable for young children to build sandcastles.When the tide is in there is very little space because of the sea wall built to stop the sea eroding the land.If you are interested in walking there is plenty of countryside to walk around.There is place of interest called Reculver Towers owned by the Department of the Environment and open to the public for a small fee.Surrounding the towers is the remains of the Roman fort now mostly ruins.Many people visit these two attractions during the year.The caravan parks are the main tourist
